H0.text: In June 1971, who was the first indigenous Australian to become a member of the Parliament of Australia. Oodgeroo Noonuccal

H1.text: In June 1971, who was the first indigenous Australian to become a member of the Parliament of Australia. Eddie Mabo

H2.text: In June 1971, who was the first indigenous Australian to become a member of the Parliament of Australia. Lowitja O'Donoghue

H3.text: In June 1971, who was the first indigenous Australian to become a member of the Parliament of Australia. Neville Bonner

A4.text: Following the resignation of senator Annabelle Rankin in 1971, Bonner was chosen to fill the casual vacancy and he became the first Indigenous Australian to sit in the Australian Parliament.
